thread.title: Playboy's history of sexy and provocative celebrity covers
thread.title_full: Playboy's history of sexy and provocative celebrity covers - seattlepi.com

author: Chris Quinn
title: Playboy's history of sexy and provocative celebrity covers
text:
Playboy recently shocked the magazine world with the announcement that they would no longer be featuring fully nude photos in their publication.
The New York Times reported that March 2016 will be the last issue to feature fully nude images.
Read more about the change here: Playboy magazine to abandon full nudity
For more than five decades, Playboy was the standard for sex and style in America. In addition to all those sexy photos, it drove consumers with features on the latest trendy products and more importantly, shaped the narrative of cosmopolitan, hip males with articles on fashion, politics, music, culture, art and sex.
And of course it was those articles that drew thousands of teenage American boys to seek out issues of the fabled publication, and squirrel away in various hidey-holes within their homes and yards.
In the more than 60 years of publication the pages of Playboy have been graced by not only beautiful Playboy models, but also the world's top actresses, athletes, musicians and pop culture icons.
From Marilyn Monroe and Ann-Margret, to Cindy Crawford and Amanda Beard, the number women who have either posed nude or appeared provocatively in the magazine are legion.
Click through the slideshow above to see a short list of 67 celebrities who made surprising – and sexy – appearances on the pages of Playboy.
cquinn@express-news.net
